content: turning for short row use wrap & turn wrap & turn having worked the last cc stitch of the chart slide next stitch to right needle with yarn in back bring yarn to front and slide the stitch back to left needle turn tighten yarn to reduce slack keep very tight for best result and work back on following rs row pick up the wrap and knit it together with the stitch it was wrapped around so that the wrap is invisible from the rs there is one foot and leg chart containing all the sizes take note of the coloured lines for each size at the toe end the chart row covers half a sock circumference you will turn and work back down the row when you re at half the circumference wanted always alternating colours that means don t work the same row twice when you turn turn after a cc row suggested for a foot circumference of around 9 inches 23 cm is to work up to and including row 37 then work back down with row 37 being your center front row this is a suggestion only high arches and wide feet may need more room others might need less your row gauge may differ from the one here you may prefer a tighter fit or a roomier sock actual circumference at 72 row to 4 inches 10 cm when turning after row 35 37 39 is 7 ¾ 8 ¼ 8 ¾ inches or 20 21 22 cm this stretches to a comfortable 11 ¾ to 13 inches 30 to 33 cm heel chart stockinette mosaic pinstripes the 35 stitches between heel markers are the heel stitches and they are worked according to the separate heel chart in a stockinette mosaic pattern with a twist for larger heel se note at bottom of page 3 stockinette means that the stitches in the colour of the row are knit on rs and purled on ws stitches in the other colour are slipped with yarn on ws of work however you have a row of decrease and increase stitches in the chart as well just to mess up the mosaic rules these stitches are worked according to the symbol always in the colour of the row first time you work the heel chart you will be decreasing stitches working from row 1 and up second time you will be increasing stitches working from row 21 and down toe the toe is worked in garter stitch knit all stitches on every row using mc only that means you will only work the toe stitches on chart row 2 4 6 etc the toe stitches are not shown in the chart every second time you reach the toe with mc you will work short row and end 5 stitches before the end
